definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless

sentences.english: There are two approaches to directly overcome disease caused by nonsense mutations.
sentences.chinese: 有兩種方法被用於治療無義突變引起的疾病。

sentences.english: As long as you love me, I will definitely not lack of justice.
sentences.chinese: 只要你們對我有情，我絕對不會無義。

sentences.english: The problem comes when life intervenes, and suddenly that simple answer proves to be empty.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在現實生活中，這些回答就顯得空洞無義。

definition: to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
